str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Third person singular active present of deo; also deon deh-on'; neuter active participle of the same; both used impersonally; it is Necessary.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: From sun and erchomai; to convene, depart in company with, associate with, or, cohabit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A space of time or interval; by extension, an individual opportunity; by implication, delay.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
